section: Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor to provide certain services and resources (the "Deliverables") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
explanation: The Recitals section introduces both 'Deliverables' and 'Services' but doesn't clearly differentiate them. Later sections only refer to 'Services,' potentially causing confusion as to whether 'Deliverables' are included within the scope of 'Services' or if they are distinct and subject to different obligations. There is no definitions for these terms, and it is unclear whether there is alignment between them.

section: 1.2 Standard of Service. (b) Supplier shall maintain complete and accurate records relating to the provision of the Services under this Agreement, in such form as Recipient shall approve.
explanation: This section refers to the 'Supplier' instead of the 'Provider' as defined in the beginning of the contract. This creates confusion as to which party is responsible for the actions in this section. It could be argued that Supplier and Provider are the same, but it should be denoted or defined within the document.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: This section has structural flaws in the text, and it does not make sense when reading it. 'This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement' does not form a coherent or grammatically correct sentence. It appears to be missing words or have extraneous words, rendering the intended meaning unclear. The reader is unsure if it is refering to a new effective date or if it is refering to the original effective date.
